values:
Not much to say this update. My "vacation" is over and it's back to work. Ryan and Steph's wedding and reception last week were fuggin awsome. I've never had such fun with my pants on. The only downside was, since I was part of the wedding party, I had to keep standing while just about everyone else got to sit. The reception was great. EVERYBODY was there and I got to see some friends I haven't seen in ages. I was coupled up w/ Melea so it was fitting that the sexiest bridesmaid and the sexiest groomsman walked down the aisle together. Yeah, I know, I'm a little vain.

On an unrelated note, I'm thinking of doing my blogging (hehehe, that sounds dirty) over on the myspace page I just set up. Anybody out there good with HTML and whatnot who wants to lend me a hand or two to make the page nice and spiffy. I'm not so great w/ that kind of stuff. Bill, your page is pretty neat looking. Any tips?
http://goodboyalex.livejournal.com/11795.html

Things have been very good lately. Maybe a little too good. I'm very much content with the state of my life right now which scares me a little since I know I should be bracing myself for the inevitable crash. I become intensely paranoid when things go my way. Something evil must be brewing just under the surface. I have one more day of work tomorrow (projection) before my little 9 day vacation. This wasn't a planned sort of thing. The schedule just kind of worked out that way and I'm pretty happy with it. I have no idea how I'm going to pass the hours of those days. All I have planned in that time is a bachelor party one day and a wedding to go to another. Man, the wedding should prove to be a surreal experience to say the least. One of my buddies is marrying my ex-girlfriend. THE ex-girlfriend. The girl that every girl I've been with since gets compared to. *sigh* I can't say I'm bitter anymore. There was time time and a place long ago when I could see myself spending the rest of my life with her but those days are long gone. It was probably just all the drugs we were doing at the time anyway. Life goes on. Besides, I'll always have the warm, fuzzy memories of Sunday mornings with Steph. God, life was never as good as it was back then. Hard to believe that was almost three years ago....i feel old.
http://goodboyalex.livejournal.com/11741.html

I'm so cool, I've learned some basic HTML (If that's even the correct term).  I'm almost as computer literate as the average 4th grader. Yay me.
Check out this ( <lj user=taxidermied> ) live journal then go to your local comic book shop and buy every single Lenore comic book you can get your hands on. If you go to Lost World Of Wonders on 69th and Oklahoma you can say 'hi" to Max. Or "fuck you", whatever floats your boat. Lenore is very funny, very dark and very macabre. Ahhh, the adventures of a cute little dead girl. Maybe I'm just sick in the head.

If you love someone, set them free. If they return to you, put several 8 inch blades in their head. If they return again, then run...just run.
http://goodboyalex.livejournal.com/11369.html

So it looks like MC Chris this saturday isn't going to happen. Stupid work. Noon to Eleven. Yeah, those are some good hours. How else would anyone want to spend their Saturday? In my on-line travels I found that Roman Dirge has a LJ which is pretty fucking spiffy. Full of nifty artwork and what not. Even if you have no clue who Roman Dirge is, you should still check it out. 

taxidermied 

I'm not cool so I can't make the name a link right to the journal, but if you search the name you'll find it. You're a clever ape.
Deliciously twisted.

P.S. Kiana is really hot. Just thought I'd state the obvious.
http://goodboyalex.livejournal.com/11227.html

I've been having trouble staying awake lately. I find myself falling asleep everytime I get comfortable. I actually fell asleep at work the other day, but it was all good because I missed a big rush. It's got to be the xanex. The Sat night gathering of Southgate employees didn't happen tonight because, yep you guessed it, I fell asleep. I had a bunch of missed calls when I finally woke up around Midnite but I didn't bother to call anyone back. I don't feel like doing much of anything lately anyways. I'm very much disgusted w/ my life right now. On a happier note, the other day at a political function of some sort my Mom was talking to an independent documentary filmmaker who was lobbying the city for money and I may be doing some work for him. One hand washes the other. Things always get worse before they get better.
http://goodboyalex.livejournal.com/10923.html
Today's the day. I just got done packing for Louisvile. Warmer climate, here I come.
http://goodboyalex.livejournal.com/10672.html

It's been a while since I've updated so I feel obligated by my boredom to do so. You can only play so much Tekken, you know? I've been on a saving money kick for the last two weeks and I think I'll have ample funds for when I bid Wisconsin farwell for spring break if i can only stop buying DVD's. I bought two of them hours after saying that I need to stop buying shit I don't need right now. Oh, well. It's only 40 bucks. I picked up Fight Club and the director's cut of Donnie Darko. I've never seen Darko so I was apprehensive about buying it, but now that I've seen it I already want to see it again. I mean, how often does a movie's plot involve time travel and a tangent universe when it's not a sci-fi flick. I thought so...

What ever happened to personal responsibility? In this foul year of our lord, 2005, personal responsibility has all but disappeared. When did this happen and where was I at the time? It must have been the nineties. The earliest example I can think of off hand is the whole Columbine tragedy. Those two fuckwits shoot up their school, killing a bunch of perfectly innocent kids in the prime of their lives, and on whom is the blame laid. The parents? No. The perpetrators? Hell no! Let's blame Wal-mart and Doom. Granted, you could buy semi-automatic weapons (or was it just ammo?) at Wal-mart at the time and that is pretty fucked up, but they were just a scapegoat on which to partially shift the blame. You can buy cigarettes at 7-11. How many people die every year from smoking related illness compared to shooting deaths? Let's skirt the real issue and lay false blame so we can feel better about ourselves as a people. It's the American way.

The tobacco industry takes a lot a heat because cigarettes give you cancer. Well....no shit. Tobacco companies spend millions of dollars a year on advertising aimed at preventing young, dumb kids from picking up this filthy, disgusting but oh so cool habit. Everybody know smoking causes cancer, not to mention plenty of other ailments. Come on people! We're living in the information age. This isn't the 1920's. It even says right on the pack in big, bold black letters "this shit will kill you", more or less. But, who is blamed when a smoker of twenty or thirty years dies of lung cancer? I'll give you three guesses and your first two don't count.

This country is also in the grips of an obesity epidemic. I don't throw that word around lightly but there is no better term to describe it. So who's to blame? Well, the answer is painfully obvious. That's right, McDonald's. (Did that come across sarcastic enough?) And here I thought a fried grease burger and half a pound of french fries (deep fried in grease) was good for you. Just remember, if you order a combo at McDonald's (super sized of course) and balance it out with a 32oz diet cola, you're only fooling yourself.

In America, money talks and bullshit walks. Nobody is really looking out for you. Not the corporations, not your government and not the pharmaceutical companies. And before you ask, no, Ronald McDonald is not looking out for you either. They are all producing commodities in which their soul purpose is to relieve you of your hard earned money.  We live in the capitalist empire of the world, so buyer beware. So if you McWeigh 300lbs when you're 13, die from lung cancer after smoking your whole life or shoot up your school after playing GTA, the blame is to be laid on nobody but yourself.
http://goodboyalex.livejournal.com/9921.html

It's hard to believe it's March already. I can't wait for summer. Can you feel that? It's getting closer. Milwaukee just has this energy in the summer that is sorely lacking the bookending months. Summer fest is always the highlight of any given year. I hate people but I love crowds. Especially crowds of drunk people at night. Summerfest will surely rock this year. I got arrested last year and got to listen to the big bang while handcuffed to a big concrete "bench". It still rocked. I went just about every day.  Wow, i'm just kinda rambling, huh? It's like my brain just threw up in here. It's been a long day and I slept like shit last night. Caffeine and ephedra are the only reason I'm still awake. I thought they took that shity off the market anyway. I found them stashed in a pantry door while looking for vivarin. Diet pills did the job tho.

Work was good today despite how lethargic I was most of the day. By the end of my shifts (plural) I was pretty awake so I just hung out in the hallway with the "cool kids"...and Potter. He he he. Sorry Pot man. Dylan wanted to race me down the hallway and I ended up smoking him, Potter and Kyle. Kyle's a lot faster than I though he would be. I declare myself the fastest Southgate employee on two legs. I should race Chris. That could be interesting.
http://goodboyalex.livejournal.com/9652.html

From the Denver Post
Aspen - In what could pass for an outlandish scene from the pages of one of Hunter S. Thompson's books, actor Johnny Depp and others who were close to the gonzo journalist are searching for a cannon and researching firing techniques to grant the author's wish that his cremated remains be blasted into the sky
"If it can be done, we will do it," said Boston entertainment lawyer George Tobia Jr., who has represented Thompson for about 15 years. "Maybe it will be part of a public thing, or maybe one night a shot will ring out and people will know."

Now I know what I want done when I die. A fitting end for HST.

Thus ends another day and I don't really have anyhting to say about it. It just hapened and my feelings are just neutral on the whole thing. I think I'm going to go see Constantine again tomorrow after my maintainence shift or finally go get a hair cut. I'm not sure which. I'll probably do neither because that's the way I am.

Wow. Work was busy as all hell tonight. Stupid Diary Of A Mad Black Woman. Man, those people just don't know how to pick up after themselves. I've never seen 1 so Goddamn messy. Oh, well. It could've been worse. The vending stand looked pretty swamped all night. I almost had to clean up vomit in the woman's bathroom but I started to gag as soon as I looked at it. I don't get paid enough to clean up that shit. Potter cleaned it up for me like the champ he is. Way to go Potter. I think I'm going to take a shower before I go out. I feel nasty but not in a good way.
http://goodboyalex.livejournal.com/8796.html

Ahhh, I love naps. I just woke up from a particurally nice on and I feel much better. I had a weird dream. I can't remember it anymore, but I get the distinct impression that it was weird. I usually remember my dreams but not today. Yesterday at work i got so bored that I started to play the "meow game" w/ all the stupid customers. Not a single person said anything. Either they were just oblivious or thought I was crazy and figured it was best to just let it go. I got a little hard at times to keep a straight face because Courtney kept laughing.  "Meow may I help you?" My record was only four though. I'll have to work at getting it up to five next time I vend. I get to ush tomorrow so there will be plenty of opportunities to fuck with the locals. I really enjoy messing w/ the people who ask if it's ok to use the bathroom when I'm a podium.
http://goodboyalex.livejournal.com/8274.html

Today was a day and stuff happened. I went to work and took apart and cleaned a projector w/ Potter. It's a lot more involved than it sounds. Won't bore w/ details. Then I dominated in some Tekken 4 before going to the bar w/ Dom and Melea. A lot of darts, pool and drinking happened. Good stuff. Later... drove through the McDonald's drive thru. In reverse.

I was waken up by some very distressing news this morning. Well, it was more like afternoon, but anyways. Hunter S. Thompson was found dead on Sunday night from an apparently self-inflicted gunshot wound to the head. He didn't even leave a frickin' note. What kind of writer doesn't even bother to leave a suicide note. Why could it have been John Grisham that blew his head off. That would've made my day. God, he sucks

Did you know that there is evidence that thousands of years ago, before civilivation was supposed to have exsisted, there was a race of humans living on this Earth that were possibly as advanced as we are today. Kinda freaky, huh? Also, this previous civilization was not the only one of it's kind to preceed our own, but the fourth. The ancient Aztecs inherited their advanced calender, more advanced that the ones were using in the fifteen hundreds, from the Omecs before them. Neither of these civilivations could wrap their collective brains around the wheel but we're supposed to believe they could tackle pyramids and advanced mathematics (the formula Pi being integrated into the pyramids they supposedly built). This ancient, but advanced calender, lays out the timeline of the previous "Four suns" that came before us. We are apparently living under the Fifth Sun. The three previous civilizations met their end due to some cataclysmic event such as the great flood that snuffed out the forth sun (not literally of course, but the people living under it). The calender predicts the the Fifth Sun will set on December 23, 2012. This same basic idea has been documented by almost every ancient civilization from every corner of the globe. 

"If you don't learn from the past, you'll be doomed to repeat it."

Also, don't exclude the cold-hearted from your "want-list", because they just might be looking for a kind person to warm up their heart.... or a sock to warm up their feet.

I got to work all day today and it was crazy busy, so my hopes of leaving early because Jerry was coming in were dashed quite quickly. It pretty much sucked all day. I just wanted to put a bullet between the eyes of every happy couple that came through the doors. Usually, I think public displays of affection are cute and sweet, but today they just made me nauseous. I couldn't wait for the day to end. By midnight, me and Dominick were at Shorty's and were toasted the death of Valentine's day. We were both glad it was over. I was so morose all day, I even tried gorging myself on chocolate but it didn't help at all.  A certain somebody tried to get ahold of me to see if I wasnted to be her Valentine, but I wasn't having it. Tomorrow will be much better.

Ward Churchill, the University of Colorado professor who compared World Trade Center victims to Nazi leader Adolf Eichmann, will be allowed to speak, as planned, at the University of Wisconsin at Whitewater on March 1. Every other college he was slated to appear at has canceled since the controversy surrounding his statements broke.

The school's chancellor said the decision to let Churchill speak was repugnant but necessary under First Amendment principles of free speech.

Free speech? Yes. But do they have to pay this asshole $4,000 to say what he has to say. I don't think so. I believe he belongs on a wooden soapbox in an alley with the rest of the vermin, but that's just me.

Our dumbass Gov. Jim Doyle was "unavailable" when Bill O'Reilly tried to contact him so he could come on The Factor and defend this position. I'm slightly ashamed to be living in Wisconsin at this moment. Fucking blue states!

It's been a while since I've updated but I still don't really have a whole lot to write about. All I've done recently is steal, er...I mean download an ass load of music. I've got a total of 4,196 songs on my iPod right now. I guess it all ties in with my compulsion to collect things like comics books and records and what not. The whole collector lifestyle is a little sad when you actually think about it. You can't connect or relate to actual people so you fill the voids in your life by obsessivly collecting things that you really don't need. At least you don't think you need them. Maybe you do. Anyway, I digress. Actually, I don't feel like writing about this anymore.
http://goodboyalex.livejournal.com/5666.html

Alright, so, I know I've said a million times I'd never order anything off the internet because I want to see something before I pay for it. Well, I buy a Cd from Amazon.com anyway and guess what? Four days later I get the wrong one in the mail from some fuggin place called The Yodeling Pig in Maryland or some shit. I ordered Outcesticide 3 The Final Solution and what do they send me? Outcesticide 1. Close, but not quite. Now I get to play E-mail tag with both of them to get the right one sent out to me. On the plus side, it's a bootleg and it didn't come in any kind of packaging so it's already copied onto my iPod. He he he. But still, now I've got to send the wrong one back and wait some more for the right one, if I even get it at all. I'll never order anything off the internet again. It's all bullshit.

Today has been nothing but a headache. I should've stayed in bed.
http://goodboyalex.livejournal.com/5580.html

Not a whole hell of a lot to report today. I got paid so I went out and bought Resident Evil 4 for my Gamecube. It's really good. Lots of blood, gore and exploding heads to keep me entertained on those long, boring nights.

The other day at the theater, this girl I dated my Freshman year in High School came in to see a movie and I don't think I've ever felt so old. That was ten years ago. A frickin' decade fer Christ's sake! It was kinda weird and a little uncomfortable to see her after so long. I didn't know what to say to her. She gave me her number but the chances of me actually using it are pretty much nil. Always move forward, never backwards.

I gotta work tomorrow morning but it shouldn't be so bad because I'm projecting, but we'll see. I have a bad feeling about tomorrow for some reason.
http://goodboyalex.livejournal.com/5328.html

Where the hell has my life gone? Almost a quarter century on this planet and what do I have to show for it? A shitty job? A few worldly possesions? Bad knees? I have squandered my entire youth with sex, drugs and alcohol and my body is slowly falling apart. *deep breath*

So, yeah. Let's see. On Tuesday a decided to skip work and drive down to Autobon Skatepark in Elk Grove, Ill w/ Chris, Mimi, Danny and Charles. I have to admit, it was more fun than fixing seats and changing lightbulbs. I don't think Potter was happy he was the only one to show up for maintainence day but, oh well. The park was pretty cool cause they're usually closed on Tuesdays so nobody else was there. On the drive home Danny told a story about him getting drunk and pissing himself because he was dreaming about pissing. It ended with the great line, "then I woke up and I was pissing myself". There's more to say right now but I don't feel like typing anymore so . . .
http://goodboyalex.livejournal.com/4872.html

Don't you love it when you get all excited about going skating? It's great. You want to go to the skatepark in Racine so you pile into the van and drive all the way down there and guess what? It's fucking closed. Since when is Captain Ron's closed on Mondays? I was just so disgusted with the whole idea of it, I just went home and forgot about skating. What a complete waste of my time. All that driving for 15 minutes of angry skating in a goddamn parking lot. 

Went and saw Finding Neverland. It was pretty good. Not great like the critics said it was. They were wrong. Ask me if I'm surprised. Another alright movie made better by Johnny Depp.

Kurt's been dead 10. Makes me feel kinda old.I found this when I was checking out some Nirvana fan site. It's kinda interesting.

The suicide note of Kurt Cobain (ooooh! Creepy)

To Boddah pronounced

Speaking from the tongue of an experienced simpleton who obviously would rather be an emasculated, infantile camplainee. This note should be pretty easy to understand. All the warnings from the punk rock 101 courses over the years. Since my first introduction to the, shall we say, ethics involved with independence and the embracement of your community has proven to be very true. I haven't felt the exitement of listening to as well as creating music along with reading and writing for too many years now. I feel guilty beyond words about these things. For example when we're backstage and the lights go out and the manic roar of the crowd begins it doesn't affect the way in which it did for Freddy Mercury who seemed to love and relish in the love and adoration from the crowd. Which is something I totally admire and envy. The fact is I can't fool you. Any one of you. It simply isn't fair to you or me. The worst crime I can think of would be to put people off by faking it and pretending as if I'm having 100 % fun. Sometimes I feel as if I should have a punch in time clock before I walk out on stage. I've tried everything within my power to appreciate it, and I do. God, believe me I do but it's not enough.

I appreciate the fact that I and we have affected and entertained a lot of people. I must be one of one of those narcissists who only appreciate things when they're gone. I'm too sensitive. I need to be slightly numb in order to regain the enthusiasm I once had as a child. On our last three tours I've had a much better appreciation for all the people I've known personally and as fans of our music, but I still can't get over the frustration, the guilt and empathy I have for everyone. There's good in all of us and I think I simply love people too much. So much that it makes me feel too fucking sad. The sad little, sensitive, unappreciative, pisces Jesus man! Why don't you just enjoy it? I don't know. I have a goddess of a wife who sweats ambition and empathy and a daughter who reminds me too much of what I used to be.

Full of love and joy kissing every person she meets because everyone is good and will do her no harm. And that terrifies me to the point to where I can barely function. I can't stand the thought of Frances becoming the miserable self-destructive, death rocker that I've become. I have it good, very good, and I'm grateful, but since the age of seven I've become hateful towards all humans in general. Only because it seems so easy for people to get along, and have empathy. Empathy! Only because I love and feel for people too much I guess. Thank you all from the pit of my burning nauseous stomach for your letters and concern during the past years. I'm too much of an erratic, moody baby! I don't have the passion anymore and so remember, its better to burn out than to fade away. Peace, love, empathy. Kurt Cobain

Frances and Courtney, I'll be at your alter.

Please keep going Courtney

For Frances

For her life which will be so much happier without me. I Love you. I love you!

Today didn't turn out like I planed, but it wasn't a bad day. I went over by Dom's this afternoon and wasted some glorious time killing people in GTA and then kicking his ass in Tekken 4 (like usual). I had just the tiniest little slip in the whole "clean" living kick I'm on, but what the hell? I'm only human after all and temptation is everywhere. It seems like I slip every time I hang out with Dom though. Coincidence? Probably not. I saw Attack On Precinct 13 with Ang tonight. It was good but I couldn't wait for it to be over so I could just go home and get away from her. I could feel her on the verge of her "Why don't you love me?" speech every time I looked at her. Maybe I'm giving her the wrong idea somehow but I can't see it. I turned my head away from her when she tried to kiss me (both times), maybe she'll finally get the hint. 

Random thoughts on Precinct 13: It was a pretty good movie and all, but not great by a long sight. Ja-rule died. That made me happy. John Legizamo was annoying more than anything and a wished for a slow and painful death for him every time he opened his mouth. One thing I don't get though, is how come in every movie when a cop announces his retirement he is doomed. I can only think of one movie where this doesn't hold true. Pretty decent flick anyway. Ethan Hawke was really good in it. B-. Nothing special.
